title: The Battle Over Union Dues
text:
The Supreme Court’s ruling last year in Janus v. Afscme was supposed to free public workers ensnared by union fees they don’t want to pay. Instead many states and unions have devised new traps, and legal fights are taking place across the country against these “Hotel California” provisions.

One example is Alaska, where the Governor and Attorney General want to build a website to let state workers authorize or cancel their dues payments at will—union membership for a Netflix age. But the unions want to maintain the status...
description: Politicians and labor try to neuter the Janus ruling any way they can.
